Key Match Events: The Cubs rallied for the tying and go-ahead runs in a five-run eighth inning.
The Los Angeles Dodgers committed three errors in the eighth inning.
Center fielder Pete Crow-Armstrong robbed Max Muncy of a potential two-run homer with two outs in the ninth.
Tommy Edman hit two solo home runs.
Max Muncy hit a homer leading off the fifth inning.
Yoshinobu Yamamoto struck out eight batters in four innings.
Pre-Game Insights: The game featured a matchup of Japanese star pitchers Yoshinobu Yamamoto and Shota Imanaga.
Counsell commented on the unique matchup of former Japanese big league rivals pitching against each other for the first time in Major League Baseball.
Post-Match Reflections: Cubs manager Craig Counsell praised the team's defense.
Max Muncy expressed frustration over the mental mistakes made during the game.
Yoshinobu Yamamoto reflected positively on his performance after returning from injury.
Pete Crow-Armstrong expressed satisfaction with the team's recent wins and momentum.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Porter Hodge experienced a heart racing issue but was cleared to pitch.
Yoshinobu Yamamoto made his first start since June 16 following a rotator cuff strain.
Shohei Ohtani remains four homers and three stolen bases from achieving a 50-50 season.
Others: The Dodgers' division lead was cut to 4 1/2 games over second-place San Diego.
Chicago Cubs are four games back of Atlanta and the New York Mets, who are tied for the last NL wild card.
